page.title: 06DAIRY FARM
page.content: The farm has been in the same family since 1942.In the past few years the farm has expanded to become one of the largest dairy farms in the area.Being near to Glasgow Airport does not seem to cause many problems to the animals or to the farmer and his family.The only disadvantages of living and working on the farm,with little outside help,are the long hours and no holidays. The sixty Ayrshire cows on the farm,are milked twice a day-at 5am and 5.45pm.The milk then goes to the Scottish Milk Marketing Board,where it is bottled and pasteurised and eventually delivered to the customers.
